meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling glass.
meanings.sent1: The vitric vase sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The windows were vitric, allowing the light to pass through easily.
meanings.sent3: She joked that his vitric personality made him see-through.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had a vitric clarity that could not be ignored.
meanings.sent5: The vitric lake reflected the surrounding mountains perfectly.

meanings.sent1: The vitric cup shattered when it fell.
meanings.sent2: The vitric sculpture was delicate but beautiful.
meanings.sent3: He tried to drink from the vitric cup, but it broke in his hand.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a vitric quality, tinkling like glass chimes.
meanings.sent5: The vitric ornaments on the tree caught the light and sparkled.

meanings.definition: Resembling glass in transparency or brittleness.
meanings.sent1: The vitric ice on the pond was dangerously thin.
meanings.sent2: Her vitric skin showed every emotion clearly.
meanings.sent3: He compared her delicate features to vitric sculptures.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like vitric walls closing in.
meanings.sent5: The vitric wings of the butterfly shimmered in the morning dew.
